intro: Agrostophyllum indifferens, commonly known as the Indian sand mat, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Agrostophyllum indifferens is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
